main_definition: To acknowledge or confess something, usually an error, fault, or fact that may be unpleasant.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To allow entry to a place
meanings_and_examples.example: The guard will admit you into the building once you show your ID.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To recognize or accept an error, fault, or guilt
meanings_and_examples.example: She had to admit that she was wrong about her interpretation of the data.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To grant legal access to a country
meanings_and_examples.example: The immigration officer admitted him into the country after verifying his passport and visa.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To acknowledge something as true or valid
meanings_and_examples.example: After years of denial, he finally admitted that climate change was real.
